areaBriefing: The Ferry Building anchors San Francisco's Embarcadero waterfront — a converted transit hub turned gourmet market with artisan food vendors, a farmers market, and sweeping views of the Bay Bridge. Parking is limited on the Embarcadero itself; the nearest garage is at 75 Howard St (~400m south), and fuel is available at the Shell station on Folsom (~800m).
fleetVisitSummary: 14 fleet visits in the last 90 days, mostly on weekdays across 4 vehicles.

areaBriefing: Downtown San Jose's convention and tech district sits at the heart of Silicon Valley, walkable to hotels, restaurants, and SAP Center. Street parking is metered on most blocks; the San Jose Convention Center garage on Market St offers day rates (~250m), and there's a Shell on W Santa Clara for fuel (~600m).
fleetVisitSummary: 22 fleet visits in the last 90 days, mostly on Tuesdays and Thursdays across 6 vehicles.

areaBriefing: Denver Union Station is the city's grand Beaux-Arts transit hub turned mixed-use landmark in the heart of LoDo, surrounded by craft breweries, restaurants, and the 16th Street pedestrian mall. The Station has a dedicated rideshare and short-term drop-off zone on Wynkoop St; the nearest full-service fuel stop is the Conoco on Blake St (~700m northeast).
fleetVisitSummary: 9 fleet visits in the last 90 days, mostly on Fridays across 3 vehicles.

areaBriefing: McCormick Place is the largest convention complex in North America, located on Chicago's lakefront just south of the museum campus — a major freight and event logistics hub. The West Building dock entrance on 23rd St handles most fleet deliveries; the BP station on S Lake Shore Dr (~550m north) is the closest fuel, and a large surface lot sits adjacent to the North Building.
fleetVisitSummary: 31 fleet visits in the last 90 days, mostly on Mondays and Wednesdays across 8 vehicles.
